verse.roman:
satyavrato 'ñjali-gatāṁ
saha toyena bhārata
utsasarja nadī-toye
śapharīṁ draviḍeśvaraḥ

synonyms: satyavrataḥ—King Satyavrata; añjali-gatām—in the water held in the palms of the King; saha—with; toyena—water; bhārata—O King Parīkṣit; utsasarja—threw; nadī-toye—in the water of the river; śapharīm—that small fish; draviḍa-īśvaraḥ—Satyavrata, the King of Draviḍa.
translation: Satyavrata, the King of Draviḍadeśa, threw the fish into the water of the river along with the water in his palm, O King Parīkṣit, descendant of Bharata.
